definition: to tattoo criminals on the face or forehead
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)
to tattoo the face (punishment in ancient times)

sentences.english: Imperial courts tattooed criminals' faces before sending them into exile.
sentences.chinese: 古代刑法规定犯人流放之前要在脸上刺字，又称黥面。

sentences.english: Most local people who enter the tsingy seek the sweet prize of honey.
sentences.chinese: 进入黥基的大多数当地人寻找甜美的蜂蜜。

sentences.english: "How will that help?" said the second boy.
sentences.chinese: 黥“那就会知道时间吗？”第二个男孩问。

definition: to amputate one or both feet (punishment in imperial China)/see also 五刑[wu3 xing2]
amputation of limbs as corporal punishment/variant of 腓, calf
scalping/to make the head bald (as corporal punishment)
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
cutting off the ears as punishment
to estimate/to fine (archaic)/variant of 資|资[zi1]
